summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI personnel at the New York Field Office discussing a request for assistance on Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) related to the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The emails coordinate scheduling for agents to help with discovery preparation and other case-related projects.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The primary FBI agent requesting assistance for Squad C-20 on the Epstein/Maxwell investigation and coordinating help with discovery preparation.

events.title: Initial request for assistance on Epstein/Maxwell case
events.description: Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) sends out a request for assistance from other FBI personnel for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, describing it as a unique opportunity to assist with a high profile case.

events.title: ERT training and office visit coordination
events.description: An FBI agent mentions attending ERT (Evidence Response Team) training in the morning and planning to visit the office around noon to assist with the Epstein/Maxwell case.

locations: 290 on the 9th floor (specific office location within FBI New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The FBI's New York Field Office Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT - Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) was actively seeking assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation in July-August 2020.
The assistance needed included preparing items for discovery with a turnaround time of end of August 2020.
The case was described as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' for FBI personnel to assist.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple FBI agents regarding scheduling and availability to work on case-related projects.
The document indicates ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein/Maxwell nearly a year after Epstein's death in August 2019.
